result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Judy M. WILSON

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State motions to dismiss and read in case. Defendant plead to OWI (2nd) charge in companion case no. 15CT401. Motion granted.
Minutes

ADDRESS INFO for Judy M. WILSON
Current: 1109 S. 25th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 11-12-2015)
Prior: 1207 Cedar Grove Lane, Two Rivers, WI 54241

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 12-10-15 at 3:45 p.m.   Plea date is set for 01-26-16 at 10:00 a.m.   
Minutes.

Defense counsel stated defendant is in the hospital.   Initial appearance is reset to 11-09-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  Possession of a Controlled Substance, on or about 10-11-2015

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess other schedule drug.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-02-2015, at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, she must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 24 hours of release, she must not operate a vehicle unless licensed, and she must maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
Blood search warrant - Section 868.12, Wis. Stats.; affidavit in support of blood search warrant; return of search warrant by law enforcement officer.
